title: Llyn Cwm Bychan Walk Route

images.title: DS Pugh / Cwm Bychan, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Cwm Bychan. Situated on the Artro. This lake is situated at the base of the Roman Steps.

images.caption: Llyn Cwm Bychan

images.title: David Medcalf / The car park in Cwm Bychan
images.caption: The car park in Cwm Bychan. At the eastern end of the lake. A campsite can also be found here.

images.caption: Tributary into Llyn Cwm Bychan

images.title: Eric Jones / Sheltering from the noonday sun
images.caption: Sheltering from the noonday sun. These glacial erratics alongside the Cwm Bychan road provide much needed shelter for sheep.

images.title: Llyn Cwm Bychan and Carreg Y Saeth, Snowdonia by I Love Colour, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Llyn Cwm Bychan and Carreg Y Saeth, Snowdonia. The view from the southern side of the water on a bright spring day.

description: Enjoy a short walk or cycle along this pretty lake in the Rhinogs. The lake is one of the sources of the River Artro which flows south westwards through Llanbedr and onwards to the sea. There is a car park at the eastern end of the lake where you can pick up the lakeside trail. It's a good surfaced track, ideal for an easy walk or cycle. The lake is surrounded by hills, rocky outscrops and interesting flora and fauna. If you would like to continue your walking in the area then you could climb Rhinog Fawr for great views over Snowdonia.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: To continue your walking in the area you could head towards the coast and pick up the Llanbedr Walk which will take you to the lovely River Artro Estuary and the Llandanwg Sand Dunes. Just to the east of the village there's also something of a hidden gem at the wonderful Nantcol Waterfalls. The area includes pleasant trails along the River Cwmnantcol with a series of rushing waterfalls to see along the way. There's also a circular walk around a small reservoir, just west of the falls. For more walking ideas in the area see the Snowdonia Walks

display_address: Cwm Bychan, Roman Steps, Llanbedr, Gwynedd, Cymru / Wales, LL45 2PH, United Kingdom
